'Our enemy has the most dangerous weapon of all: knowledge.'

Your summoning has fallen prey to your adversary's countermeasures. Mystic Hunters know the proper protections, and will usually survive attacks from summoned Minions. But sooner or later, they'll make a mistake.

'But - no-one could have survived that!'

Now and then, Tenacious Hunters somehow survive attacks that should have killed them. But their luck always runs out in the end; and there are other ways to destroy a Hunter beside physical assault.
Send a silent Minion to resolve the problem of a Hunter
This will probably ensure the Hunter ceases to trouble us. [This is less likely to succeed than an Edge attack, and success or failure will both draw attention, but the minion will usually survive.]
Send a quiet Minion to resolve the problem of a Hunter

My Minion will watch and wait. If we're lucky, they may have an opportunity to dispose of our enemy. [This is less likely to succeed than an Edge attack, and success or failure will both draw attention, but the minion will usually survive.]
Send a cautious Minion to resolve the problem of a Hunter

My Minion will wait for the right moment, though most likely that moment will never come. [This is less likely to succeed than an Edge attack, and success or failure will both draw attention, but the minion will usually survive.]
My minion has returned, with a trophy.
No summoned creatures currently attack with Winter. This is in case I add one later.
My minion has returned. There was no opportunity to end the Hunter's life; and the Hunter may now be aware of danger.
Send an Unstoppable Force to murder a Hunter
Unless this Hunter has some unusual protection, they're already dead. But their demise will attract attention.
100% success rate means this should never be visible.
Send a Potent Minion to murder a Hunter
My minion is powerful. This Hunter is unlikely to survive. But the attempt will draw attention.
Send a Minion to murder a Hunter
My minion's skills are limited. This Hunter will probably survive, and the attempt will draw attention.
Send Someone Unsuitable to Murder a Hunter
My minion lacks the Edge aspect, and is woefully unsuited to attacking the hunter. There's a small chance they might succeed.
My minion has returned, with a trophy.
My minion has returned, with a prisoner!
My minion has not returned. They must have failed.
Send a Devious Minion to destroy Evidence
My scheme will most likely succeed. There is always a chance that something will go awry.
No Moth 10 here. There are currently no Moth 10 minions, but also we don't want a 100% chance because there's no downside. This could easily change later.
Send a Minion to destroy Evidence
My minion's talent for deceit is limited, and this is a difficult task. They will likely fail.
Send Someone Unsuitable to Destroy Evidence
My minion lacks the Moth aspect, and will be out of their depth. There's a small chance they might succeed.
My minion has returned. The evidence has been destroyed. I am a little safer.
My minion has not returned. They have failed, and their blundering may have attracted attention...
Share a terrible mystery of the Ragged Lore
'When the Forge is cold and the Glory is dark and the Wood is dust, perhaps the Wolf Divided will rest, but only until it can devour itself. Hear me now...'
Share the colder invocations of the Ragged Lore
'There is a power that commemorates and grieves, from whom nothing is taken, but who cannot be deceived. I will tell you that power's name. Listen to me...'
'Let's speak of endings. Let's speak of the declining sun. Let's speak of things that aren't quite dead, and won't quite die...'
Describe the horrors awaiting an adversary
'Something to think about, every time you close your eyes.' [This may demoralise the Hunter, but may also increase your own Dread.]
The Horrors Beneath the World's Skin
'All right, it might end badly for me, but it's worth the sacrifice. And others will carry on the struggle. We'll meet again. [Idealists cannot be demoralised.]
The Horrors Beneath the World's Skin
Your account is too much for the Hunter. Their eyes bulge. Their jaw tightens. In the days to come, they will sink inexorably into despair.
The Horrors Beneath the World's Skin
The Hunter growls defiance, but you can see that your words have found their mark. [This Hunter has become Grim.]
The Horrors Beneath the World's Skin
'Yes, there are terrible things in the world, but that's all the more reason to resist them. I should thank you. You've shown me what I must do.' [This Hunter has become an Idealist.]
The Horrors Beneath the World's Skin
'Yes, there are terrible things in the world, but that's all the more reason to resist them. I should thank you. You've shown me what I must do.' [This Hunter has become an Idealist.]
Share a terrible mystery of the Glorious Lore
'This is the secret doctrine of the Door-in-the-Eye. Open your ears...'
Share the brighter invocations of the Glorious Lore
'The Door-in-the-Eye navigates; he is not merciful; but first and always, he illuminates. Listen, and be illuminated...'
'There are finer things than we see. You must have felt it. Consider the possibilities of eternity...'
Describe your visions to your adversary
The higher you rise, the more you'll see.' [This may distract the Hunter, but may also increase your own Fascination.]
'That sounds pretty. But I've got a job to do. You'll hear from me again. [Grim Hunters cannot be Fascinated.]
Your account is too much for the Hunter. Their eyes grow wide and bright. Their smile becomes dreamy. In the days to come, they will forsake everything they once knew.
The Hunter scoffs, but you can see that the urgency of your account has struck a spark. [This Hunter has become an Idealist.]

'Yes, I could be something finer, but what we are is less important than what we do. The world is where we live, and I will defend it till I die. You can keep your visions.' [This Hunter has become Grim.]
